page.title: 18Changes in Melling - Part 1
page.content: Twenty years since 1965 have seen many changes in the way of life and work in Melling. Five working farms have reduced to two; three farm houses are now private houses; two barns have been converted to four dwellings; with two more pro- posed; two farm cottages are now let; and a total of ninteen new houses have been built. The sale of land from the three farms has resulted in random ownership of fields in the valley and on the hillside, now used as out-fields for stock-rearing. On only one farm is a younger generation involved in the day-to-day work. Population changes have seen an increase in pensioners (mostly widows) and an influx of staff from the University and local industry or com- merce,though this has now slowed,due to cut-backs and closures.<Continued..
